page.title: 02Cranshaws Village
page.content:
At the SE of the village is the church built of whinstone with a roof of west moorland flags. The graveyard runs round the church bounded by a drystone dyke as is the manse which is also made of whinstone.
There are four semi-detached houses made of bricks with slate roofs. There is a car park in front of the gardens.
There is a small house made of stone - it has harled walls. The village hall is built in the same way as the house. There is a telephone box outside the hall. The school is to the North of the village and has a school house joined onto it where the teacher lives.
